title.rendered: Find Rooms For Rent In Pittsburgh

content.rendered:
In recent years, Pittsburgh has emerged as one of America’s brewing capitals. Pittsburgh is located in a beautiful setting. Located at the point the Allegheny, Ohio, and Monongahela rivers meet, makes it an aesthetic spot to visit in the country. Undoubtedly, it’s a great place to not just tour, but live in! That’s where Roomi comes in! We’ll help you find cheap rooms for rent in Pittsburgh, and make your experience worthwhile.

Getting to know Pittsburgh

Pittsburgh is called the “City of Bridges” for good reason. With 446, it has more bridges than any other city in the world. With beauty, culture, and good, honest fun to enjoy, Pittsburgh is a city that’s well worth exploring. Moreover, while looking for cheap rooms for rent in Pittsburgh, you can nourish your love for festivals and multicultural dining. Come along for the ride as we show you all the things you need to know to enjoy this fun-filled city.

Finding Rooms for rent in Pittsburgh

Based on the most recent research, the average rent for rooms in Pittsburgh is $1,246. Renter-occupied households account for 56% of the total occupied housing units in Pittsburgh.

Neighborhoods with cheap rooms for rent in Pittsburgh include Carrick, Perry North, and Perry South where average rents are less than $736 per month.

Rooms for rent in Pittsburgh with the highest monthly rents include neighborhoods such as Homewood West, Larimer, and Morningside where rents average $1,654 per month.

Related: 20 Super Important Questions To Ask Your Landlord Before Moving In

Find rooms for rent in Pittsburgh

Top Neighborhoods in Pittsburgh

Downtown: The cultural center of Pittsburgh is also the most convenient place to stay. It’s located on a peninsular called “the Point” and feels like a mini-Manhattan, with its dense towers and cluster of museums and theaters.

South Side: The place to go for bars and restaurants, South Side is a hilly neighborhood that provides some incredible views of Pittsburgh. It’s not hard to reach, thanks to funicular railways like the Duquesne Incline. Head down to Carson Street for the best eateries.

East End: It is a creative quarter with plenty of bars, restaurants, and stores to explore. It’s a green area, with places to relax like Frick Park, Moreover, it’s also home to great attractions like the collection of dinosaur skeletons in the Carnegie Museum of Natural History.

Average rent in Pittsburgh

Average Cost of Living in Pittsburgh

University life in Pittsburgh

Top Universities in Pittsburgh

Pittsburgh is full of great entertainment, shops, restaurants, theaters, galleries, museums, sports teams and much more. Perfect place for local as well as international students to imbibe the vibrant city life! If you’re looking for rooms for rent in Pittsburgh while pursuing your studies, here are the top 5 universities to checkout.

  • Carnegie Mellon University
  • University of Pittsburgh
  • Duquesne University
  • Carlow University
  • Robert Morris University

How transit-friendly is Pittsburgh?

Walkability in Pittsburgh

Pittsburgh has good public transportation and is somewhat bikeable. Besides, it’s one of the most walkable city in the country. With a Walk Score rating of 63, Pittsburgh is a somewhat walkable city. For instance, the most walkable Pittsburgh neighborhoods are Downtown, Central Oakland and Friendship.

Public Transportation in Pittsburgh

Pittsburgh’s Port Authority runs an extensive bus network and a small light rail service (which is handy for reaching the sporting venues). Further, fares are based on “zones”, but most of the time visitors will stick to Zone 1, where the basic fare is $2.50 per journey. There’s also a free fare zone right in the center of town, where all bus travel is completely free of charge.

Taxis in Pittsburgh

Taxis are an excellent way to get around the city. Basic fares are $3.50 for the meter drop, then $5.30 for every subsequent mile and $28 for every hour of waiting. Similarly, Uber offers a base fare of $2.50, then $1.55 per mile, so is usually a cost effective alternative**.**

Airports in Pittsburgh

There are numerous airports in Pittsburgh. However, the major airports include:

Pittsburgh International Airport

Allegheny County Airport – AGC

Finleyville Airport

See also: The Do’s And Don’ts Of Sharing An Apartment For The First Time

Cultural activities in Pittsburgh

Part of the attraction lies in Pittsburgh’s culture. With one of the U.S.A.’s largest collections of theater companies, the Three Rivers Film Festival, a world-class symphony orchestra, and a respected ballet company, Pittsburgh is a cultural powerhouse.

But high culture isn’t the only appeal. You can join the masses as they cheer on the Steelers NFL team, take craft brewery tours, dine on mountains of Polish dumplings at restaurants like Pierogies Plus, or watch indie bands perform at venues like the Smiling Moose. There’s so much to explore!

Restaurants in Pittsburgh

  • 9 Café: Located in the heart of Wilkinsburg, 9 Café welcomes the community with authentic and affordable food.
  • Arnold’s Tea: Featuring more than 30 types of tea, Arnold’s also serves coffee, sandwiches, salads, and more.
  • Aunt Cheryl’s Café: Serving food from the heart, the café includes breakfast and lunch with catering options available.
  • Back to the Foodture: This creative Contemporary American restaurant takes a modern twist on wings, burgers, grilled hotdogs and fries.
  • Blowfish BBQ: Based in a food truck, Blowfish BBQ features low and slow wood-fired, Pittsburgh-style BBQ.

Pittsburgh’s strong, close-knit neighborhoods, festivals, and celebrations has earned its reputation as one of America’s most-livable cities. Inspired and influenced by the city’s rich history and cultural heritage, you’ll never get bored in this city! The beauty of Pittsburgh lies in its simplicity. If you’re looking for change or inspiration, find rooms for rent in Pittsburgh to start living your best life.

D’you know what else Roomi does outside of helping its readers find cheap rooms for rent in Pittsburgh? With our ever-increasing lists of rooms and roommates across the world, we help you find your perfect match! Download the app here and hop on the easiest ride home, ever!
